topics.author: 5154c5237f123bcd580002fc

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/541a49296368723578250100#post_541a49296368723578250100
they pretty good
like the megaman adaptations are spot on

as for archie

having a comic series that was based on two cartoon shows, and was trying to combine the ideas from those shows, with the games, as well all their own original ideas
it's pretty good

it's a rough, boring, cliche read at first, expected considering it was pretty much just a cash in at the time
but it does improve quite a bit over time

although during the megaman/sonic crossover, there were a bunch of copyright issues with a guy who made a bunch of characters and ideas for the comic, not being satisfied over various things, so when the crossover ended, multiple story lines had to be dropped and there was a just a massive retcon

yes they had a sonic/megaman crossover event

topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/541a465c6368723936a00100#post_541a465c6368723936a00100
In a group work, I usually assign tasks to other people who I believe is more capable and give them useful ideas and how-to's in their tasks. If we were making something, I would give them points and factors which can be used to make that 'something'. I analyze any of the ideas stated by them and see whether they are acceptable in the situation. I also modify their ideas.

In other words, my skill would be telling people how to do jobs efficiently so I don't have to.
